pullRequests.title: Addition of Garage Door Controller and combined Fan on/off, fan speed, Light on/off drivers.
pullRequests.body:
Sorry Johan I could not make it splitting in to PR somehow. I am not totally friends with git yet.
Good that chatgpt is around, otherwise it would have taken some time I think:-).

These 2 drivers are orthogonal except for that the garage door controller has a new Tuya datapoint and the fan/light switch has a new flow card to be able to set the fan speed, but also to be able to display the speed set on the device tile.
The garage door controller I model as a lock to be able to display in the device tile if the door is open or closed.

The 2 new tuya devices I have added support for are:

fan_light_switch_tuya: TS0601_TZE204_lawxy9e2
garage_door_controller: TS0601 _TZE204_nklqjk62

pullRequests.title: Make fingerbot (_TZ3210_j4pdtz9v) work
pullRequests.body:
The current driver does not work, it also has three issues:


- The bot does not report battery
- The bot only has one mode
- The bot identifies as a simple plug or button

I modelled the driver after a plug and now it works :)

pullRequests.title: Update 1_button_2 driver
pullRequests.body:
Button action was not identified correctly.
LongPress added as button action.
Changed icon and pictures.
++++++++++++++
The identification of the button action did not work.
The best result was achieved by identifying the number 253 in the frame.data. The next number in the frame.data reflects the button action (see also smart_remote_1_button, with the difference that the position in the frame.data has shifted from [1] to [3]).
This version is tested extensively.
Unfortunately I could not get the battery measurement reporting to work. Probably because this is a "sleeping" device.

I did not change the coding regarding the handling of cluster-id 8. Although I suspect that the dimming capabilities are only working if a touchlink connection is established.

See also Issues #1011 and #1026 .

Added Rain sensor _TZ3210_tgvtvdoc / TS0207
pullRequests.body:
Driver for the Tuya RB-SRAIN01 solar rain sensor. The functionality of this driver matches the drivers in ZHA and Zigbee2MQTT.

The rain intensity is a bit odd, as it is reported in millivolts, for details, see for example [this review](https://smarthomescene.com/reviews/tuya-zigbee-solar-rain-sensor-rb-srain01-review/).

pullRequests.title: Bugfix: Fix TZ3000_abrsvsou dimmer
pullRequests.body:
The dimmer value has two bugs:
1) Homey flows works much better with a 0-1 base, and according to the docs it should not be minus. Thus you can detect plus/minus depending on the direction turned.
2) The dim reported from the device is 250 per half-turn (as in 500 per one rotation). So the value should be divided by 500.
NOTE: The device is speed-sensitive. A full rotation is max 500 when turning it very fast and minimum 25 if going slow... 100 is the "normal speed"

pullRequests.title: Add support for "Smart Knob Switch" (TS004F / _TZ3000_abrsvsou)
pullRequests.body:
This adds support for the "smart knob switch"
In addition to the actions, a "dim" is also declared, this property contains the rotation reported from the device. The device, in addition to which way it was rotated also reports a dimming amount/duration - which Im mapping to "dim"

pullRequests.title: Support for smoke detector _TZ3210_up3pngle / TS0205
pullRequests.body:
Adds support for the _TZ3210_up3pngle / TS0205 smoke detector.

The device uses the IASZone cluster for smoke, tamper and battery alarms.
For the battery level status it uses the PowerConfiguration cluster.
Therefore, the proposed device driver uses these two clusters to update the Homey device functions.

There are several issues that relate to or require the implementation of this device:
#483 
#543 
#736 
#776

pullRequests.title: Add missing manufacturer for TS0203 door/window sensor
Add support for 2 channel/gang curtain module j1xl73iw
pullRequests.body:
This PR is what is seems, it support two channel curtain module (like `j1xl73iw`). As it requires a submodule to control both channels, I created a new device folder for it.

Any comments are welcome. 

I have one issue that I might need to change: on the primary module, the state states `UP` and `DOWN` and set position work correctly, but the `OPEN` and `CLOSE` do not. On the submodule, all three methods work well. 

Still, it does the job, up and down works, set to % also. 

This will fix #362 as well

pullRequests.title: Make motion sensor (TUYATEC-bd5faf9p / Nedis ZBSM10WT) work
pullRequests.body:
Not sure if they've released different versions under the same manufacturer name, but the existing driver didn't work.

With this:

- Don't attempt to configure reporting (unsupported general command)
- Remove the alarm_tamper capability (not seen anything about this being supported and only see the alarm being reported)
- Implement the onZoneStatusChangeNotification
- Keep the measure_battery capability and implement it by periodical polling
- Remove the alarm_battery capability as per the best practices which says never to implement both this and measure_battery

Caveat emptor: I'm new to both Homey and Zigbee so perhaps I'm missing something very obvious or have otherwise done things wrong or in a less than optimal way, but with this the sensor (motion, battery) works. 

As an aside the sensor itself seem very shaky and prone to always report motion in some scenarios (two consecutive status updates with one no-motion followed directly by a motion one). Not sure what is going on there, but seems to be rather common complaint just looking at some reviews.

issues.title: Device Request - Roller Shutter Switch - _TZE284_uqfph8ah / TS0601
Feature Request - Mired /white level adjustment
issues.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem or is it a nice addition? Please describe.**
Some devices do have wrong white values. e.g. the mood light from lidl can be much more warm white when paired directly to homey then through the app. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**

A Advanced setting where you can adjust the mireds, Prefilled with the current value read from the device itself

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

The alternative is to pair the devices as a basic zigbee device but that is a hassle with constanly disabling the Tuya zigbee app

**Additional context**

Feel free to connect to investigate this further

Device Request - 2 Gang Zigbee Switches - BSEED / TS0012

Device Request - [WoodUpp CREATE LED] - [WoodUpp] / [CREATE LED]
Device Request - [pir Motion sensor] HOBEIAN ZG - 204Z]
issues.body: could you please add support for this Zigbee motion sensor? • Manufacturer: HOBEIAN • Product ID: ZG-204Z • Device type: enddevice (PIR Motion Sensor) • Battery: CR2450, Zigbee 3.0 In Homey it only pairs as “Unknown Zigbee device” and does not expose motion or battery. Screenshots attached: • Developer Tools (manufacturer & product ID, firmware, device ID) • Pairing process (Unknown Zigbee Device added) Diagnostics Report ID: 34063866-26d8-4e4d-a155-5aca20fd6347 Docs: https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/ZG-204Z.html Thanks a lot!

Bug report - pls add missing writeInteger in TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js
issues.body:
### Describe the bug

I am using Smart water timer and it stopped working and I got error when I wanted to control this device few months ago, but I did not have time to investigate. I have identified issue now, It seems that someone wrongly deleted in library _TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js_  definition of "writeInteger" datapoint and value. Could you just please restore "async writeInteger" ? 

### To Reproduce

Steps to identify error:

1. Go to TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js  (https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/lib )
2. Search for writeInteger and please restore part which was wrongly deleted.
3. Why writeInteger? Because in device.js in https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/drivers/smart_water_timer is using it and I am getting an error when I want to control Smart Water Timer.
4. then pls reinstall com.tuya.zigbee App
5. If no error could you please update it for everyone?

### App and Homey version

> * What Homey version are you running? Homey Pro (Early 2023) 12.5.2
> * What version of Homey firmware do you use? 12.5.2
> * What version of the Tuya Zigbee App are you using? 0.2.73 Development

fix(repo): Résolution définitive du conflit par recréation de la branche
issues.body:
### Problème : Le Paradoxe du Workflow (Catch-22)

Le workflow GitHub Actions sur la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` est bloqué dans un état de conflit insoluble.

1.  **Le workflow actuel est défectueux** : Il tente une opération `git rebase` qui échoue systématiquement à cause de conflits profonds avec le dépôt `upstream`.
2.  **La correction est bloquée** : Toute tentative de pousser un commit pour corriger le fichier de workflow déclenche le workflow défectueux. Celui-ci échoue avant même que la correction ne puisse être appliquée.

Le workflow se sabote lui-même, empêchant toute mise à jour.

### Solution : Contournement et Recréation Manuelle

Pour briser ce cycle, la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` doit être supprimée et recréée manuellement sur GitHub à partir d'une source saine. Cette action n'est pas un commit et ne déclenchera donc pas le workflow défectueux.

**Étapes de la résolution :**
1.  Une nouvelle branche saine (`jules-final-fix`) a été créée localement.
2.  Cette branche contient le workflow final "auto-réparateur", capable de gérer les futures synchronisations.
3.  La branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera supprimée de GitHub.
4.  Une nouvelle branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera créée à partir de `jules-final-fix`.

Cette procédure garantit que la branche est saine et contient un workflow fonctionnel dès sa création.

issues.title: fix(workflow): Résolution finale des conflits de rebase persistants
issues.body:
### Problème

Le workflow GitHub Actions échoue systématiquement à cause de conflits de `git rebase` avec le dépôt `upstream`. Les tentatives de correction via des scripts locaux n'ont pas réussi à mettre à jour le fichier de workflow sur GitHub, entraînant des échecs répétés.

### Solution

Le contenu du fichier `.github/workflows/tuya-zigbee-auto-contributions.yml` a été remplacé manuellement par une version corrigée et robuste.

#### Changements clés :
- **Suppression du Rebase :** L'étape de synchronisation (`Sync with Upstream`) a été modifiée pour ne faire qu'un `git fetch` sans tenter de `rebase` ou de `merge`. C'est l'action principale qui résout le conflit.
- **Utilisation d'un PAT :** Le workflow utilise maintenant un Personal Access Token (`secrets.MY_PAT`) pour toutes les opérations Git et API, afin d'éviter les problèmes de permissions.
- **Amélioration du Débogage :** Des commandes `echo` ont été ajoutées à chaque étape pour permettre un suivi clair de l'exécution dans les logs.
- **Commit et Push sécurisés :** La logique de commit a été améliorée pour ne s'exécuter que si des changements réels sont détectés.

issues.title: Device Request – Roller Blind Motor – _TZE204_ahwvlkpy / TS0601
issues.body:
Prerequisites:
Before requesting a device addition, please ensure there is not already a request for the device among the open issues.

Make sure your Homey is upgraded to firmware v5 or higher.

You need a physical example of the device.

Device Information
Device Name: Tuya Zigbee Roller Blind Motor

Device Model: TS0601

Device Description: Zigbee 3.0 tubemotor for roller blinds (EYA25G-WF), controllable via up/stop/down. Often used for DIY blinds and curtains.

Link to device image: https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005007184765210.html

Device Interview
json
Kopiëren
Bewerken
{
  "ids": {
    "modelId": "TS0601",
    "manufacturerName": "_TZE204_ahwvlkpy"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "1": {
      "clusters": {
        "input": [
          "genBasic",
          "genTime",
          "genPowerCfg",
          "genIdentify",
          "manuSpecificTuya"
        ],
        "output": [
          "genOta"
        ]
      },
      "bindings": []
    }
  },
  "manufacturerName": "_TZE204_ahwvlkpy",
  "modelId": "TS0601",
  "applicationVersion": 70,
  "zclVersion": 3,
  "hardwareVersion": 1,
  "dateCode": "20210916",
  "powerSource": "DC Source",
  "softwareBuildId": ""
}
Additional Comments:
This is a Tuya Zigbee 3.0 roller blind motor (EYA25G-WF) purchased via AliExpress:
https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005007184765210.html

It pairs with Homey but is added as an "Unknown Zigbee Device". Please add support under the cover (blinds) driver, similar to other TS0601 motors.

Thanks for the great work and for maintaining the Tuya Zigbee app!

How to interview a device
Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey

Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee

Interview the device using the 🔍 button

Click the copy icon to capture the device info

Paste the copied JSON in the section above

To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!

Device Request – Motion Sensor – _TZ3000_o4mkahkc / TS0202
issues.body:
### Prerequisites:

- Before requesting a device addition, please ensure there is not already a request for the device among the open issues.
- Make sure your Homey is upgraded to firmware v5 or higher.
- You need a physical example of the device.

### Device Information

- Device Name: _TZ3000_o4mkahkc
- Device Model: TS0202
- Device Description: Tuya Zigbee PIR motion sensor. Battery-powered (CR2450), wall- or ceiling-mountable, sends motion events and sometimes tamper or battery status.
- Link to device image: https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005007862729814.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.16.5fe179d2wHavE6&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld#nav-specification

### Device Interview

```json
{
  "ids": {
    "modelId": "TS0202",
    "manufacturerName": "_TZ3000_o4mkahkc"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "1": {
      "clusters": {
        "input": [
          "genBasic",
          "genPowerCfg",
          "msOccupancySensing",
          "genIdentify"
        ],
        "output": [
          "genOta"
        ]
      },
      "bindings": [
        {
          "cluster": "genPowerCfg",
          "target": {
            "endpoint": 1,
            "ieeeAddress": "0x00158d000xxxxx",
            "type": "endpoint"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  "manufacturerName": "_TZ3000_o4mkahkc",
  "modelId": "TS0202",
  "applicationVersion": 66,
  "zclVersion": 3,
  "hardwareVersion": 1,
  "dateCode": "20220101",
  "powerSource": "Battery",
  "softwareBuildId": "1.0.6"
}
```

### Additional Comments:

> **Note: I bought the device via AliExpress:
https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005007862729814.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.16.5fe179d2wHavE6&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld#nav-specification

This is a very common Tuya PIR motion sensor (TS0202 variant), but not yet matched by the current app. It’s detected as an unknown Zigbee device in Homey (even with the test version of the Tuya Zigbee app). Would love to have this added.

Thanks in advance!

### How to interview a device

- Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey
- Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee.
- Interview the device, the button for this is to the right of the device in the list of Zigbee units.
- Click the copy button/icon to capture the device information.
- Paste the copied information above.

> **Note:** To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!

issues.title: Device Request - Soil meter - HOBEIAN/ ZG-303Z
Device Request - [tuya zigbee smart IR-remote] - [tuya] / [CB3S or ih-f8260]
Device Request - [Zigbee Light Switch Push Button] - [_TZ3000_zxrfobzw] / [TS0002]
Device Request - [Soil Temperature Moisture Plant Sensor] - _TZE200_npj9bug3 / TS0601
Bug report - [Short description]
issues.body:
### Describe the bug

The soil sensor device _TZE284_aao3yzhs shows completely incorrect values for both humidity and temperature (67109121% and 67109120°C respectively), and battery information is not displayed at all. The device appears to be using the Tuya proprietary cluster format but the current driver is trying to interpret the data as standard Zigbee values, resulting in corrupted readings.

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Homey App' → 'Devices' → 'Add Device'
2. Select 'Tuya Zigbee' app
3. Choose 'Soil Sensor' (first option under soil sensors)
4. Pair the _TZE284_aao3yzhs device
5. View the device card in Homey
6. See incorrect values: Luftfuktighet: 67109121%, Temperatur: 67109120°C, Battery: no data

### Expected behavior

The device should display:
- Realistic soil moisture percentage (0-100%)
- Realistic temperature readings in Celsius
- Battery percentage or voltage information
- Proper battery alarm functionality when battery is low

### App and Homey version

- Homey Pro with firmware 7.4.2-0
- Tuya Zigbee App version v0.2.73Test

###

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f9f5b76f-1bca-455a-a33d-be03824ab9c7)

![Soil Sensor showing incorrect values](user-provided-screenshot-showing-67109121-percent-humidity-and-67109120-celsius-temperature)

The screenshot shows the device card displaying:
- Luftfuktighet: 67109121%
- Temperatur: 67109120°C  
- Batteri: (no data shown)
- Batterialarm: (no data shown)

### Additional context

- Device manufacturer/model: _TZE284_aao3yzhs (soil moisture sensor)
- This is a Tuya device that likely uses the proprietary Tuya cluster (0xEF00/61184) for data transmission
- The values 67109120/67109121 (0x04000000/0x04000001 in hex) suggest raw Tuya cluster data being misinterpreted as standard Zigbee values
- Device paired successfully but was automatically assigned to existing "Soil Sensor" driver which doesn't properly handle this specific manufacturer variant
- This is the first Tuya device being tested in this Homey setup
- Diagnostic ID available: d424bf60-018c-4bea-acff-0ff80c363c67
- The device requires specific driver support for _TZE284_aao3yzhs to properly decode Tuya proprietary data format

issues.title: [FIX] Résoudre le rejet du push (rejected master -> master)
issues.body:
### Décrire le bug
Lors de l'exécution de `git push`, l'opération est rejetée avec le message d'erreur :
`! [rejected]        master -> master (fetch first)`
`error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee.git'`

### Reproduire le bug
1. Avoir des commits locaux sur la branche `master`.
2. Avoir un commit sur la branche `master` distante (sur GitHub) qui n'est pas présent localement.
3. Exécuter `git push origin master`.

### Comportement attendu
Le push devrait réussir, mais il est bloqué par sécurité car les historiques ont divergé.

### Contexte additionnel
Ce problème est survenu car le fichier `automation.yml` a été modifié directement sur l'interface web de GitHub, tandis que du code pour des appareils (boutons 3 et 4 gangs) a été commité localement.

La solution consiste à synchroniser les changements distants avant de pousser, en utilisant `git pull --rebase` pour maintenir un historique propre et linéaire.

issues.title: Intégrer les évolutions de code pour les boutons 3 et 4 gangs
issues.body:
### Description de la Tâche
L'utilisateur @dlnraja a développé du code pour la prise en charge de nouveaux appareils :
- Boutons 3 gangs
- Lumière (light) 4 gangs

Ces modifications ont été faites localement et poussées via plusieurs "push", mais elles ne semblent pas être présentes sur la branche `master` du dépôt `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee`.

### Objectif
S'assurer que toutes les modifications de code locales de l'utilisateur sont correctement commitées et poussées vers la branche `master` du dépôt sur GitHub.

### Étapes à suivre (pour @dlnraja)
Pour synchroniser votre code local avec le dépôt GitHub, veuillez exécuter les commandes suivantes dans votre terminal PowerShell sur votre ordinateur :

1.  **Se placer dans le bon dossier :**
    ```powershell
    cd C:\Users\HP\Desktop\com.tuya.zigbee
    ```

2.  **Vérifier la branche actuelle :**
    ```powershell
    git branch
    ```
    *(Assurez-vous que l'étoile `*` est bien à côté de `master`)*

3.  **Ajouter tous vos fichiers modifiés :**
    ```powershell
    git add .
    ```

4.  **Créer un "commit" qui sauvegarde vos changements :**
    ```powershell
    git commit -m "feat: Add support for 3-gang and 4-gang devices"
    ```
    *(Si vous avez un message d'erreur disant "nothing to commit", passez à l'étape suivante).*

5.  **Pousser vos changements vers GitHub :**
    ```powershell
    git push origin master
    ```

Une fois ces commandes exécutées, votre code sera à jour sur GitHub.

issues.title: [BUG] Le workflow échoue à l'étape de checkout avec une erreur de token liée aux permissions du fork
issues.body:
### Describe the bug

> Le workflow `Automated Tuya Zigbee Contributions` échoue systématiquement à l'étape `actions/checkout@v4` avec l'erreur : `Error: Input required and not supplied: token`.

Ce problème persiste malgré les tentatives de correction suivantes :
1.  Ajout de la section `permissions` avec les droits `contents: write` et `pull-requests: write` dans le fichier `automation.yml`.
2.  Configuration des paramètres du dépôt (`Settings > Actions > General`) pour accorder les permissions de "Lecture et écriture" aux workflows.

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Aller à l'onglet 'Actions'.
2. Sélectionner le workflow 'Automated Tuya Zigbee Contributions'.
3. Lancer le workflow manuellement via 'Run workflow'.
4. Observer l'échec à l'étape 'Run actions/checkout@v4'.

### Expected behavior

> Le workflow devrait s'exécuter avec succès, en particulier l'étape de `checkout`, car les permissions ont été configurées.

### App and Homey version

> * What Homey version are you running?
> * What version of Homey firmware do you use?
> * What version of the Tuya Zigbee App are you using?

### Screenshots

> L'erreur est visible dans les logs du workflow : `Error: Input required and not supplied: token`

### Additional context

> **Hypothèse :** L'erreur est très probablement due aux restrictions de sécurité que GitHub impose aux workflows s'exécutant sur des dépôts clonés (forks). Par défaut, le `GITHUB_TOKEN` a des permissions restreintes en lecture seule, ce qui nécessite une approbation manuelle pour élever les privilèges.
> 
> **Contexte de la session :**
> - **Utilisateur :** dlnraja
> - **Date de l'erreur :** 2025-07-20 15:54:29 UTC

issues.title: Bug: Échec de l'automatisation à cause d'un historique Git conflictuel insoluble
issues.body:
### Describe the bug
L'automatisation des contributions sur le fork `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee` échoue systématiquement à cause d'un historique Git conflictuel. Les tentatives de synchronisation, de nettoyage de branche, ou de push forcé se soldent par des erreurs persistantes, rendant le workflow inopérant. Le problème est si profondément ancré que seule une réinitialisation complète du dépôt (suppression et nouveau fork) a permis de le contourner.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Utiliser le fork initial de `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee`.
2. Tenter de mettre en place un script (PowerShell ou via GitHub Actions) pour synchroniser la branche avec `upstream/master`.
3. Essayer de résoudre les conflits ou de forcer un push.
4. Constater les erreurs telles que `! [remote rejected]` ou des échecs de rebase infinis.

### Expected behavior
Le workflow d'automatisation devrait pouvoir se synchroniser avec le dépôt `upstream`, appliquer les modifications de code et de documentation, et pousser les commits vers le fork `origin` sans être bloqué par des conflits historiques insolubles.

### Screenshots
Les logs des terminaux PowerShell partagés dans la conversation illustrent les différentes erreurs rencontrées.

### Additional context
Le problème a été résolu en supprimant complètement le fork `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee` et en en créant un nouveau, vierge de tout historique conflictuel. La nouvelle configuration, basée sur ce dépôt propre, est maintenant fonctionnelle. Cette issue documente le "bug" initial pour mémoire.
